title: Privacy Policy
content:
• To provide a personalized and continually improving service, we track users, both logged in and otherwise, through first-party cookies. Read more in our our cookie policy.
  • When registering as a user we collect data such as your email address and name, as well as the time of registration, your approximate location, IP address, information about your browser and computer, signup source, and more. This will be used to provide a personalized service, such as sending newsletters, protecting against spam, and complying with relevant laws (including GDPR), and other things.
  • We might enhance your registered profile with additional data from publicly available sources, including but not limited to social media and other public websites. For example, we may use the Gravatar service to show a profile picture associated with your email address, if one is available.
  • We reserve the right to use your name, likeness, social media handles, and similar for marketing purposes, on social media, etc.
  • We will not sell or give your personal information to any third party, unless when required by law and compelled to do so by the relevant authorities, through a sale of the business, or with explicit consent.
  • When registering for any events or webinars on nomadgate.com organized by one of our partners, in order to facilitate the registration the information you submit will be shared both with Nomad Gate and the relavant partner, as well as with Zoom Video Communications, Inc.
  • You may at any time withdraw your consent to receiving emails from us (newsletters and community notifications), by using the unsubscribe links that are included in all such emails. Note that the newsletter and community emails are separate systems, and you need to click unsubscribe in each. You can also control the type of community notifications you get by adjusting the settings in your control panel.
  • You may at any time contact us by writing to privacy@nomadgate.com to request information about what data we have stored about you, and also request the data to be corrected, updated, or removed. We will comply without undue delay.
  • We may change this Privacy Policy as we may deem necessary from time to time, or as may be required by law. Any changes will be immediately posted here and you will be deemed to have accepted the updated Privacy Policy on your first use of the website following the alterations. We recommend that you check this page regularly to keep up-to-date.

Your personal data may be processed by one or more of these subprocessors:

  • Amazon Web Services, Inc., United States/Ireland—Backups
  • CloudFlare, Inc., United States—Content delivery network
  • DigitalOcean, LLC, United States—Server infrastructure for forums
  • Formagrid, Inc. (d.b.a. Airtable), United States—Database
  • Google LLC (Google Analytics, Google Cloud Platform, & G Suite), United States—Analytics, APIs, web servers, encrypted backups, email support
  • Mailshake, LLC, United States—Customer communication
  • Netlify, Inc., United States—DNS, content delivery network, forms
  • Logflare LLC, United States—Logs
  • OneSignal, Inc., United States—Push notifications
  • Optimaize GmbH (d.b.a. NameAPI), Switzerland—Name parsing API
  • Paperform Pty. Ltd., Australia—Signup and other forms
  • Pipedream, Inc., United States—Technical backend and APIs
  • Sumo Group Inc. (d.b.a. SendFox)—Sending newsletters
  • SendGrid, Inc., United States—Transactional & marketing email
  • Smel Nov Svyat EOOD (d.b.a. Encharge), Bulgaria—Marketing automation and newsletters
  • Supabase, Inc., United States—Database and backend services
  • TheChecker LLC, United States—Email validation
  • Zapier, Inc., United States—Technical backend and APIs
  • Zoom Video Communications, Inc., United States—Webinar registration and hosting

Past subprocessors (no longer in use):

  • Disqus, Inc., United States—Article comments (not used since May 2018)
  • Intercom, Inc., United States—Customer support & analytics (not used since May 2018)
  • Joshua Anderton Design (d.b.a. Upscribe), Canada—Signup forms (not used since June 2018)
  • ConvertFox, Inc. (d.b.a. ConvertFox), United States—Customer support & analytics (not used since December 2018)
  • iterative s.r.o. (d.b.a. Customer.guru), Czech Republic—Product feedback (NPS) (not used since January 2019)
  • Metrics Delivered LLC (d.b.a. NeverBounce), United States—Email validation (not used since March 2020)
  • Typeform S.L., Spain—Forms (not used since November 2022)

Last updated: December 20, 2022
